firstContext: The value of the @context property MUST be one or more URIs, where the value of the first URI is https://www.w3.org/2019/did/v1.
multipleURIS: If more than one URI is provided, the URIs MUST be interpreted as an ordered set.
mustHaveContext: DID Documents MUST include the @context property.
oneContext: A DID Document MUST have exactly one top-level context statement.
keyContext: The key for this property (context) MUST be @context.
firstURIMustBe: The value of this key MUST be at least the URL for the generic DID context: https://www.w3.org/2019/did/v1.
methodContextNoOverride: Method-specific contexts MUST NOT override the terms defined in the generic DID context.
oneSubject: A DID Document MUST have exactly one DID subject.
mustBeId: The key for this property MUST be id.
mustBeDID: The value of this key MUST be a valid DID.
mustContainId: However, the fully resolved DID Document MUST contain a valid id property.
mustBeJSON: A DID Document MUST be a single JSON object conforming to [RFC8259].
mayHaveAuth: A DID Document MAY include an authentication property
shouldBeAuthMethods: The value of the authentication property should be an array of verification methods
verificationEmbedRef: Each verification method MAY be embedded or referenced
mayHaveService: A DID Document MAY include a service property
serviceIsArray: The value of the service property should be an array of service endpoint
mustHaveIdTypeEndpoint: Each service endpoint must include id, type, and serviceEndpoint properties, and MAY include additional properties
serviceMustBeJSON: The value of the serviceEndpoint property MUST be a JSON-LD object or a valid URI
mayHavePublicKey: A DID Document MAY include a publicKey property
noKeyThenAssumeRevoked: If a public key does not exist in the DID Document, it MUST be assumed the key has been revoked or is invalid.
mustHaveRevokedProp: A DID Document that contains a revoked key MUST also contain or refer to the revocation information for the key (e.g., a revocation list).
mustBeArrayOfKeys: The value of the publicKey property MUST be an array of public keys.
keyMustHaveTypeAndUniqueId: Each public key MUST include id and type properties, and exactly one value property. The array of public keys MUST NOT contain duplicate entries with the same id.
keyMustHaveController: Each public key MUST include a controller property, which identifies the controller of the corresponding private key.
keyMustHaveKeyMaterialType: The value property of a public key MUST be exactly one of publicKeyPem, publicKeyJwk, publicKeyHex, publicKeyBase64, publicKeyBase58, publicKeyMultibase, depending on the format and encoding of the public key.
schemeMUSTlowercase: The did: scheme name MUST be lowercase.
methodMUSTlowercase: (did) The method name MUST be lowercase.
mustDefineMethodNameAndId: A DID method specification MUST further restrict the generic DID syntax by defining its own method-name and its own method-specific-id syntax.
methodSpecificParam: A method-specific parameter name MUST be prefixed by the method name as defined by the method-name rule.
MUSTBeURIPath: A generic DID path is identical to a URI path and MUST conform to the the path-abempty ABNF rule in [RFC3986].
MUSTbeURIQuery: A generic DID query is identical to a URI query and MUST conform to the the query ABNF rule in [RFC3986].
MUSTbeURIFragment: A generic DID fragment is identical to a URI fragment and MUST conform to the the fragment ABNF rule in [RFC3986]
MAYCombineParams: Method-specific parameter names MAY be combined with generic parameter names in any order.
